Package it.polimi.vovarini.model

Class Game

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.vovarini.model.Game
All Implemented Interfaces:
GameDataAccessor, java.io.Serializable
public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable, GameDataAccessor
This class represents a Santorini game.
See Also:
Serialized Form

    void addPlayer​(java.lang.String nickname)
    This method adds a new player with the given nickname to this game, then raises a NewPlayerEvent.
    void drawElectedPlayer()
    This method chooses a random player as the new current player.
    GodName[] getAvailableGodCards()
    Getter method for the set of cards in play in this Game

    Getter method for the Board where the game is played

    Getter method for the current Phase the game stands in

    Getter method to get the Player currently playing

    Getter method for the number of players who will play the Game

    Getter method to get the Players playing this game
    boolean isAvailableCardsAlreadySet()
    This method checks if the cards to play in the Game are already set
    boolean isFull()
    This method checks if all players entered correctly in the Game
    boolean isSetupComplete()
    This method returns if the setup of the game is complete
    void nextPlayer()
    Rotates the current player to the next one, then raises a CurrentPlayerChangedEvent.
    void performMove​(Construction move)
    Executes the given construction on this game, raising a PlayerInfoUpdateEvent to add the move to the list on the Player class.
    void performMove​(Movement move)
    Executes the given movement on this game, raising a PlayerInfoUpdateEvent to add the move to the list on the Player class.
    void setAvailableGodCards​(GodName[] availableGodCards)
    Setter method for the set of cards in play in this Game
    void setCurrentPhase​(Phase phase)
    Sets the current phase to the given one, then raises a PhaseUpdateEvent.
    void setPlayers​(Player[] players)
    Setter method to set the Players playing this game
    void setupGodCards()
    Rotates the current player to the next one, then it either raises a SelectYourCardEvent if they still have to choose a god card or a PlaceYourWorkersEvent if the worker placement phase can start.
    void start()
    Starts the game and raises a GameStartEvent.
    void undoLastMove()
    This method undoes the last move done by the player currently playing

  • Constructor Details

    • Game

      public Game​(int numberOfPlayers) throws InvalidNumberOfPlayersException
      Creates a Game with the given number of players.
      Parameters:
      numberOfPlayers - How many players should be allowed into this game.
      Throws:
      InvalidNumberOfPlayersException - If numberOfPlayers is less than 2 or greater then 3.

  • Method Details

    • getBoard

      public Board getBoard()
      Getter method for the Board where the game is played
      Specified by:
      getBoard in interface GameDataAccessor
      Returns:
      the instance of the Board where the game is played

    • addPlayer

      public void addPlayer​(java.lang.String nickname)
      This method adds a new player with the given nickname to this game, then raises a NewPlayerEvent. No validity check on nickname is performed.
      Parameters:
      nickname - the name of the player to be added
      Throws:
      InvalidNumberOfPlayersException - if this game is full.

    • drawElectedPlayer

      public void drawElectedPlayer()
      This method chooses a random player as the new current player.

    • setupGodCards

      public void setupGodCards()
      Rotates the current player to the next one, then it either raises a SelectYourCardEvent if they still have to choose a god card or a PlaceYourWorkersEvent if the worker placement phase can start.

    • performMove

      public void performMove​(Movement move)
      Executes the given movement on this game, raising a PlayerInfoUpdateEvent to add the move to the list on the Player class. If this move leads to a win for the current player, this method also raises a VictoryEvent.
      Parameters:
      move - The movement to be performed.

    • performMove

      public void performMove​(Construction move)
      Executes the given construction on this game, raising a PlayerInfoUpdateEvent to add the move to the list on the Player class.
      Parameters:
      move - The construction move to be performed.

    • getCurrentPhase

      public Phase getCurrentPhase()
      Getter method for the current Phase the game stands in

      Returns:
      the instance of the current Phase the game stands in

      Setter method for the set of cards in play in this Game
      Parameters:
      availableGodCards - the names of the GodCards to be played in this game

    • nextPlayer

      public void nextPlayer()
      Rotates the current player to the next one, then raises a CurrentPlayerChangedEvent.
      Specified by:
      nextPlayer in interface GameDataAccessor

    • setCurrentPhase

      public void setCurrentPhase​(Phase phase)
      Sets the current phase to the given one, then raises a PhaseUpdateEvent. If the current player can't perform any move in the new phase, if only one other player is left, it raises a VictoryEvent, otherwise it uses Player.setHasLost(boolean) to signal the player loss.
      Specified by:
      setCurrentPhase in interface GameDataAccessor
      Parameters:
      phase - The desired new phase.

    • undoLastMove

      public void undoLastMove()
      This method undoes the last move done by the player currently playing

    • start

      public void start()
      Starts the game and raises a GameStartEvent.

    • isSetupComplete

      public boolean isSetupComplete()
      This method returns if the setup of the game is complete
      Returns:
      true if the setup of the game is complete, false othwerise

    • isFull

      public boolean isFull()
      This method checks if all players entered correctly in the Game
      Specified by:
      isFull in interface GameDataAccessor
      Returns:
      true if all players entered correctly in the Game, false otherwise

    • isAvailableCardsAlreadySet

      public boolean isAvailableCardsAlreadySet()
      This method checks if the cards to play in the Game are already set
      Returns:
      true if the cards to play in the Game are already set, false otherwise

    • getInitialNumberOfPlayers

      public int getInitialNumberOfPlayers()
      Getter method for the number of players who will play the Game
      Returns:
      the number of players who will play the Game
